format: A data frame with 26796 observations on the following 18 variables.

parameters.birthy: student's birth year - an ordered factor with levels 1977:1982
parameters.exp:
a numeric vector - the total number of years of
experience of the teacher
parameters.ses:
socioeconomic status - a factor with levels
F and N representing eligible for free lunches or
not eligible
parameters.eth:
student's ethnicity - a factor with the same
levels as trace
parameters.trace:
teacher's race - a factor with levels W,
B, A, H, I and O representing
white, black, Asian, Hispanic, Indian (Native American) and other
parameters.birthq:
student's birth quarter - an ordered factor with
levels 1977:1 < ... < 1982:2
parameters.yrs:
number of years of schooling for the student - a
numeric version of the grade gr with Kindergarten
represented as 0.  This variable was generated from gr and
does not allow for a student being retained.
parameters.schtype:
school type - a factor with levels
inner, suburb, rural and urban
parameters.clad:
career ladder position of the teacher - a factor
with levels NOT APPR PROB PEND
1 2 3
parameters.sx: student's sex - a factor with levels M F
parameters.gr:
grade - an ordered factor with levels K <
1 < 2 < 3
parameters.math: the student's total math scaled score
parameters.read: the student's total reading scaled score
parameters.hdeg:
highest degree obtained by the teacher - an
ordered factor with levels ASSOC < BS/BA <
MS/MA/MEd < MA+ < Ed.S < Ed.D/Ph.D

reference:
Details of the original data source and the process of conversion to
this representation are given in the vignette.
title: Student Teacher Achievement Ratio (STAR) project data
description:
Description
Data from Tennessee's Student Teacher Achievement Ratio (STAR) project
which was  a large-scale, four-year study of the effect of reduced class size.
